p: True causality, in a Humean sense, cannot be inferred ( Hume, 1993; Kant, 1998). Among other reported approaches to ascertaining causal dependency relationships, the work of J. Pearl ( Pearl, 2009a) is perhaps most visible, and builds on the paradigm of structural causal models (SCM) ( Pearl, 2009b). While Pearl’s work is often claimed to be able to answer causal queries regarding the effects of potential interventions, as well as regarding counterfactuals, our objective in this paper is somewhat different. We are interested in delineating whether infection transmission pathways can be distilled from the patterns of infection’s spatio-temporal incidence.
